strapiPost.title: New Fay Jones Exhibit At Shiloh Museum Of Ozark History
strapiPost.content:
Shiloh Museum of Ozark History has opened a fascinating digital exhibit on the works of Fay Jones called Housing the Human and the Sacred, which utilizes gaming technology and touch screens to explore Jones' architecture in 3D.

  • All-Time Great: Jones is a legendary architect and a University of Arkansas alumnus whose designs utilize simple materials like stone, wood, and glass. His most famous work is the Thorncrown Chapel near Eureka Springs, which the American Institute of Architects lists as one of the most significant buildings of the 20th century.
  • Hands-On History: Shiloh Museum has several exciting and educational exhibits, including hands-on activities where you can explore the extraordinary history of the Arkansas Ozarks from prehistoric to modern times.

Find more information about Shiloh Museum's current exhibits HERE.
